requirements_mapping.high_level_requirement: User registration and login with email/password and social OAuth (Google, GitHub)

security_controls.requirement: Verify all authentication functions require a username and password, and sessions are established using secure session tokens. Passwords are validated using secure hashing and salting algorithms.
security_controls.relevance: Directly applies to email/password registration and login; ensures session tokens and password storage use secure methods. It sets baseline authentication security requirements for any user login functionality.
security_controls.integration_tips: Use strong hashing (e.g., bcrypt/argon2) with per-user salts and enforce secure session tokens with proper attributes (HttpOnly, Secure, SameSite). Ensure registration flows validate inputs and do not leak account existence via timing/errors.
security_controls.verification_method: Review password hashing configurations, perform code inspection of authentication code, and run authentication flow tests including session token attribute checks.

security_controls.requirement: Authenticator Management: Organizations manage information system authenticators by establishing, issuing, and revoking authenticators such as passwords and tokens.
security_controls.relevance: Covers lifecycle of authenticators for email/password and OAuth tokens; ensures proper issuance and revocation processes exist. Important for handling account compromises and token revocation for social logins.
security_controls.integration_tips: Implement centralized authenticator lifecycle management including password reset, rotation, and revocation for OAuth tokens. Integrate with identity provider APIs to revoke tokens and maintain revocation logs.
security_controls.verification_method: Inspect authenticator management procedures, test token revocation flows with providers, and review logs showing issuance and revocation events.

security_controls.requirement: User access provisioning should be implemented based on business and information security requirements. Access rights shall be reviewed regularly.
security_controls.relevance: Ensures that user accounts created via registration are provisioned with appropriate rights and subject to periodic review. Applies to initial account creation and social/OAuth-linked accounts.
security_controls.integration_tips: Implement user provisioning workflows that assign minimal default privileges and include periodic access reviews. Link account lifecycle events to provisioning records for auditability.
security_controls.verification_method: Review provisioning workflows, sample user accounts to verify assigned rights, and review records of access right reviews.

requirements_mapping.high_level_requirement: Single Sign-On (SSO) via OIDC and SAML for enterprise customers

security_controls.requirement: Applications that support federated authentication must validate identity tokens using the provider's public keys and verify all token claims and audiences.
security_controls.relevance: Direct requirement for OIDC/SAML validation; enforces cryptographic validation of tokens and checking of claims to prevent impersonation. Essential for secure SSO.
security_controls.integration_tips: Use well-maintained libraries to validate ID tokens and SAML assertions, fetch and cache provider public keys (JWKS), and verify audience, issuer, expiry, and nonce parameters.
security_controls.verification_method: Penetration testing of SSO flows, code review of token/assertion validation, and checks that invalid/malformed tokens are rejected.

security_controls.requirement: Use of SAML and other federated identity attributes for authentication must ensure assertions are validated and replay-protected.
security_controls.relevance: Specifies validation and replay protection for SAML/OIDC assertions which is directly applicable to SSO. Prevents assertion replay and misuse of federated credentials.
security_controls.integration_tips: Implement audience restriction, timestamp checks, one-time-use/nonces, and verify assertion freshness. Employ secure channels for metadata exchange and rotate keys as necessary.
security_controls.verification_method: Review SAML/OIDC library configurations, test replay attempts, and verify assertion validation logic and timestamps.

security_controls.requirement: Where required, secure log-on procedures shall be implemented, and authentication mechanisms should support federated identity when used by the organization.
security_controls.relevance: Provides organizational control requiring secure log-on and allowance for federated identity; aligns policy with SSO implementation. Ensures SSO is integrated into secure access policies.
security_controls.integration_tips: Update access control policies to include federation; document how SSO providers are approved and how authentication is logged. Ensure training and procedures for SSO onboarding.
security_controls.verification_method: Review policy documents, SSO onboarding records, and evidence that secure log-on procedures are followed (logs, configurations).

requirements_mapping.high_level_requirement: Role-based access control (Admin, Project Manager, Data Scientist, Viewer) and team workspaces

security_controls.requirement: Verify that role-based access control enforces least privilege and separation of duties; authorization checks must be enforced server-side.
security_controls.relevance: Directly applicable to implementing RBAC and enforcing server-side checks for roles like Admin and Data Scientist in team contexts. Prevents client-side bypass.
security_controls.integration_tips: Design RBAC with clearly defined roles and permissions, implement centralized server-side policy enforcement, and model team workspace scoping for resource access.
security_controls.verification_method: Access control tests (attempt privilege escalation), code review for server-side enforcement, and role permission matrices verification.

security_controls.requirement: Account Management: The organization manages system accounts, including owner, group, and role assignments and privileges.
security_controls.relevance: Describes account and role management processes required to implement RBAC and team workspaces, ensuring accounts and roles are managed consistently.
security_controls.integration_tips: Define role lifecycle procedures (creation, modification, removal), standardize role definitions, and integrate with identity management for teams and groups.
security_controls.verification_method: Review account management procedures, audit role assignment logs, and sample checks of group/role membership.

security_controls.section: Access to networks and network services
security_controls.requirement: Access to systems and services should be controlled by access control mechanisms and role definitions appropriate to user responsibilities.
security_controls.relevance: Reinforces requirement to restrict access according to roles and responsibilities; applicable to team workspace access and segregation.
security_controls.integration_tips: Map business roles to system roles, document access matrices, and include role-based controls in access control policy. Conduct periodic access reviews.
security_controls.verification_method: Review role mapping documents and logs of access reviews; test that role changes reflect expected permissions.

requirements_mapping.high_level_requirement: User profile management with avatar uploads, preferences, and 2FA support

security_controls.requirement: Applications must support multi-factor authentication for sensitive functions and provide secure mechanisms for managing user profile data.
security_controls.relevance: Directly applicable to adding 2FA to profiles and ensuring profile data management is secure. Emphasizes MFA for sensitive actions and proper handling of profile data.
security_controls.integration_tips: Offer TOTP/WebAuthn options for 2FA, protect profile endpoints with strong authentication, and require re-authentication for sensitive profile changes. Store preferences securely.
security_controls.verification_method: Test MFA enrollment and enforcement flows, review profile management API security, and inspect authentication controls for sensitive changes.

security_controls.requirement: Identification and authentication (organizational users) – The system uniquely identifies and authenticates organizational users; multi-factor authentication is required for high-risk operations.
security_controls.relevance: Defines MFA requirements and unique identification which directly apply to profile management and sensitive preferences or avatar uploads that could introduce risk.
security_controls.integration_tips: Apply MFA for high-risk profile operations (credential changes, sensitive preferences) and ensure user ID uniqueness and secure authentication storage for recovery processes.
security_controls.verification_method: Review MFA usage logs, perform attempts to bypass MFA, and validate uniqueness checks in authentication flows.

security_controls.requirement: Access to information and application functions should be restricted and managed, including user profile information; media and file handling considerations apply to uploads.
security_controls.relevance: Covers restrictions on profile data and file uploads such as avatars; highlights need to manage and restrict access to uploaded media.
security_controls.integration_tips: Implement file upload restrictions (type/size), store files on segregated storage with restricted permissions, and apply virus scanning and metadata stripping.
security_controls.verification_method: Inspect file handling code, test upload vectors, and verify access controls to stored avatars and profile data.

requirements_mapping.high_level_requirement: Create and organize ML projects with metadata, tags, and access controls

security_controls.requirement: Metadata and object-level access control must be enforced; access control policies should consider object attributes like tags and ownership.
security_controls.relevance: Directly relevant for project and metadata-level access controls so that tagging and metadata do not bypass authorization.
security_controls.integration_tips: Implement attribute-based access control (ABAC) where tags/metadata influence policy evaluation; ensure server-side enforcement of object-level permissions.
security_controls.verification_method: Test access to objects with different tag/ownership combinations and review policy evaluation logs.

security_controls.requirement: Access Enforcement: The information system enforces approved authorizations for logical access to information and system resources in accordance with applicable access control policies.
security_controls.relevance: Ensures that access control policies for projects and metadata are enforced consistently across the system.
security_controls.integration_tips: Centralize enforcement points for project resources, ensure policies are well-defined and consistently applied across APIs and UI, and log enforcement decisions.
security_controls.verification_method: Review enforcement points, run policy conformance tests, and inspect authorization logs for policy application.

security_controls.requirement: Assets associated with information and information processing facilities should be identified and an inventory maintained, including classification and ownership.
security_controls.relevance: Project and dataset artifacts are information assets; identifying owners and classification supports correct access controls and handling.
security_controls.integration_tips: Maintain an inventory of projects and assigned owners; classify projects by sensitivity to drive access control rules and retention policies.
security_controls.verification_method: Inspect the asset inventory and mapping of owners/classifications to access controls.

requirements_mapping.high_level_requirement: Experiment tracking with versioning, metrics, artifacts, visualizations and comparison UI

security_controls.requirement: Protect data integrity and provide mechanisms for versioning and tamper-evidence of critical artifacts and datasets.
security_controls.relevance: Addresses need for integrity and tamper-evidence for experiment artifacts and metrics to ensure trustworthiness of tracked experiments.
security_controls.integration_tips: Use content-addressable storage or checksums to detect tampering, sign critical artifacts, and maintain immutable versioned histories for artifacts and metrics.
security_controls.verification_method: Verify artifact signing/checksum verification, test tamper detection, and review version history logs for integrity.

security_controls.requirement: Configuration Change Control: The organization develops, documents, and maintains baselines and tracks changes to system components and artifacts.
security_controls.relevance: Applies to tracking experiment configurations and versions as part of configuration management to ensure traceability and controlled changes.
security_controls.integration_tips: Maintain baselines for experiments and configurations, track changes with metadata (who, when, why), and integrate change control into comparison UI.
security_controls.verification_method: Review change tracking records, test ability to view diffs between versions, and confirm baselines exist for experiments.

security_controls.requirement: Changes to information processing facilities and systems should be controlled to prevent unauthorized changes.
security_controls.relevance: Ensures experiment changes and artifact updates go through controlled change processes to avoid unauthorized modifications.
security_controls.integration_tips: Require approvals for production-affecting experiment runs, log changes to experiment metadata, and integrate change tickets with experiment promotions.
security_controls.verification_method: Review change management tickets tied to experiments and audit logs for unauthorized modifications.

requirements_mapping.high_level_requirement: Save and share experiment configurations as templates and project-level sharing settings

security_controls.requirement: Ensure that sharing and template features respect authorization policies; ability to share must be constrained by role and ownership rules.
security_controls.relevance: Directly mandates that sharing templates must honor authorization and not allow privilege escalation or data leakage via templates.
security_controls.integration_tips: Implement checks on template creation and sharing that validate sender and recipient permissions; include audit trails for shares and enforce least privilege.
security_controls.verification_method: Test sharing scenarios across roles, attempt unauthorized shares, and inspect share audit logs.

security_controls.requirement: Least Privilege: The organization ensures that users are granted the least privileges necessary to accomplish their tasks, including sharing capabilities.
security_controls.relevance: Ensures sharing is limited to necessary privileges; templates should not grant more access than intended.
security_controls.integration_tips: Design sharing permissions with role-based constraints and require owners/admin approval for broader sharing; provide granular share scopes.
security_controls.verification_method: Review permission assignments, simulate least privilege violations, and check enforcement logs.

security_controls.requirement: Information transfer policies should include controls for sharing and distribution of information within and outside the organization.
security_controls.relevance: Applicable to templates and project-level sharing policies to ensure sharing respects organization policies and external transfer controls.
security_controls.integration_tips: Create policies for internal/external template sharing, require explicit opt-in for external shares, and log transfers and consent.
security_controls.verification_method: Review information transfer policies and check logs for adherence to procedures during sharing operations.

requirements_mapping.high_level_requirement: Activity feed and audit logs for project and system changes

security_controls.requirement: Application must generate logs for security-relevant events and ensure logs cannot be tampered with; include user actions, admin actions and data changes.
security_controls.relevance: Directly mandates logging of user and admin actions relevant to activity feeds and audit trails to support accountability and forensics.
security_controls.integration_tips: Log critical events with non-repudiation mechanisms (append-only storage, HMAC) and separate privileges for log access; include contextual metadata (user, project, action).
security_controls.verification_method: Inspect logs for required events, attempt tampering to validate protections, and verify retention/rotation policies.

security_controls.requirement: Audit Events: The information system must determine and record auditable events and provide a record of actions taken.
security_controls.relevance: Specifies which events to audit and records to maintain, directly applicable to activity feed and audit logs design.
security_controls.integration_tips: Define auditable events per system components (project changes, permissions changes), ensure timestamps and actor IDs are recorded, and protect audit records.
security_controls.verification_method: Review audit event definitions, inspect sample logs, and validate completeness against event list.

security_controls.requirement: Event logs recording user activities, exceptions, and information security events should be produced and retained.
security_controls.relevance: Reinforces need for event logging and retention policies covering system and project changes for compliance and incident response.
security_controls.integration_tips: Define retention periods, secure log storage, and access controls for log review. Integrate logs into SIEM for monitoring and alerting.
security_controls.verification_method: Check log retention configurations, review access controls to logs, and confirm logs include required event types.

requirements_mapping.high_level_requirement: Conversational AI assistant (LLM) with chat UI, multi-language support and saved chat history

security_controls.requirement: Sensitive data processed by application features like chat should be classified and protected; stored chat history must be access-controlled and encrypted.
security_controls.relevance: Directly relevant to protecting chat transcripts and LLM interactions which may include PII or sensitive project context.
security_controls.integration_tips: Encrypt chat histories at rest, apply access controls based on roles and project context, classify content and redact or mask sensitive items prior to storage.
security_controls.verification_method: Review encryption configurations, test access control enforcement to chat data, and validate classification/masking mechanisms.

security_controls.requirement: Information Security Architecture: Ensure that system design includes protections for privacy and confidentiality of user-generated content and retains accountability.
security_controls.relevance: Requires architectural consideration for LLM components to protect privacy and ensure accountability for generated/stored content.
security_controls.integration_tips: Design the LLM integration with privacy-by-design principles, include data minimization, and log model inputs/outputs for accountability while protecting sensitive items.
security_controls.verification_method: Review architecture diagrams, validate data flows, and confirm presence of privacy controls and logging/monitoring for LLM services.

security_controls.section: Privacy and protection of personally identifiable information
security_controls.requirement: Personal data shall be protected in accordance with relevant legislation and organizational policies, including chat transcripts.
security_controls.relevance: Ensures chat history and personal data processed by the assistant are protected in line with legal/regulatory obligations.
security_controls.integration_tips: Implement user consent mechanisms, define retention for chat data, and provide controls for export/deletion to meet data subject rights.
security_controls.verification_method: Review compliance documentation, consent flows, and test export/deletion processes for chat transcripts.

requirements_mapping.high_level_requirement: Natural-language search across experiments, models, datasets and chat history

security_controls.requirement: Search functionality must enforce access control checks on results and avoid information leakage via search suggestions or metadata.
security_controls.relevance: Search across sensitive artifacts must not return unauthorized results; prevents leakage via NLP search suggestions or indexed metadata.
security_controls.integration_tips: Ensure search index enforces row-level security, filter results by user/project permissions, and sanitize suggestion engines to avoid exposing counts or metadata of inaccessible items.
security_controls.verification_method: Test search queries across roles/projects, attempt to infer existence of items via side-channels, and review index access controls.

security_controls.requirement: Access Control for Mobile Devices and Remote Access: Limitations and protections on information retrieval mechanisms must be enforced to prevent unauthorized disclosure.
security_controls.relevance: Mandates protective controls for remote search and retrieval mechanisms to prevent unauthorized disclosure; applies to natural-language search.
security_controls.integration_tips: Apply authentication/authorization on search APIs, rate-limit queries to mitigate enumeration, and log search access for auditing.
security_controls.verification_method: Review search API auth enforcement, rate-limit configurations, and audit logs for search access patterns.

security_controls.requirement: Access rights should be reviewed to ensure that search and retrieval functions do not expose data beyond authorized users.
security_controls.relevance: Supports ongoing verification that search permissions align with assigned access rights and prevent inadvertent exposure.
security_controls.integration_tips: Include search access checks in periodic access reviews and adjust index/build processes when access rights change.
security_controls.verification_method: Check results of access reviews, and validate that changes to permissions update search index behavior.

requirements_mapping.high_level_requirement: AI-powered code suggestions, explanations, experiment summaries, and automated insights

security_controls.requirement: AI-generated outputs that may expose sensitive information must be sanitized and the model prompts/outputs should be logged and controlled for confidentiality.
security_controls.relevance: Directly relevant: AI outputs can leak secrets or IP; this control mandates sanitization and control over model prompts/outputs to prevent leakage.
security_controls.integration_tips: Implement output filters that detect and redact secrets, log prompts/outputs for review with access controls, and apply model input sanitization to avoid leaking sensitive content.
security_controls.verification_method: Review logs to ensure prompt/output recording and filtering, test the system by feeding sensitive prompts and verifying redaction.

security_controls.requirement: Error Handling and Information Leakage: Applications must detect and protect against unauthorized dissemination of information via outputs and generated content.
security_controls.relevance: Requires detection and prevention of output-based leakage, applicable when code suggestions or summaries could reveal sensitive or proprietary data.
security_controls.integration_tips: Add detectors for confidential patterns (API keys, secrets) in AI outputs, restrict model capabilities for certain projects, and implement human review for high-risk outputs.
security_controls.verification_method: Conduct tests that confirm detection of secret patterns, review human-in-the-loop approvals, and audit output logs for leakage incidents.

security_controls.requirement: Controls should be applied to tools and utilities that can access sensitive information, including AI tools that generate or transform data.
security_controls.relevance: Ensures AI tooling that can access or generate sensitive content is treated like privileged utilities and controlled accordingly.
security_controls.integration_tips: Restrict AI tool access with least privilege, log usage by identity/project, and require approvals for access to datasets or models that produce sensitive outputs.
security_controls.verification_method: Review access controls for AI tooling, usage logs, and approval workflows for privileged AI features.

requirements_mapping.high_level_requirement: Context-aware help respecting current project context and user role

security_controls.requirement: Contextual features must honor authorization policies and ensure that help or guidance does not reveal unauthorized data or operations.
security_controls.relevance: Context-aware help must not reveal information outside a user's role; enforces that help respects authorization boundaries.
security_controls.integration_tips: Ensure help content generation queries use the same authorization layer as UI views; mask or suppress details the user is not authorized to see.
security_controls.verification_method: Test help outputs in various roles/projects and confirm no unauthorized data is revealed.

security_controls.requirement: Least Privilege Enforcement: Systems that provide context-based capabilities must apply least privilege to contextual data and actions.
security_controls.relevance: Reinforces applying least privilege to contextual help and preventing exposure of higher-privilege details through help features.
security_controls.integration_tips: Implement scoping of contextual help queries to the user's effective permissions and avoid aggregating information across projects unless permitted.
security_controls.verification_method: Perform privilege escalation tests using contextual help and log analysis to ensure scoping is honored.

security_controls.requirement: Users must be made aware of their security responsibilities; context-aware help should align with these policies.
security_controls.relevance: Ensures help does not contradict organizational security policies and that user-facing guidance reinforces security responsibilities.
security_controls.integration_tips: Align help text with security policies and include reminders of responsibilities in context-aware tips, especially for privileged actions.
security_controls.verification_method: Review help content against policy and gather user feedback on compliance alignment.

requirements_mapping.high_level_requirement: Chat export and per-user chat history controls (export/delete)

security_controls.requirement: Provide mechanisms for users to export their data and request deletion; systems must verify authenticity of requests and ensure propagation.
security_controls.relevance: Directly applies to chat export and deletion flows, enforcing verification and safe execution of these operations.
security_controls.integration_tips: Implement authenticated export endpoints with rate limits and data packaging, and ensure deletion routines remove data from primary and backup stores where required.
security_controls.verification_method: Test export and deletion flows end-to-end including backups, and verify authenticity checks and propagation to dependent systems.

security_controls.requirement: Media Sanitization: Ensure data is properly removed from storage when deletion/export requests are fulfilled.
security_controls.relevance: Ensures deleted chat history is sanitized from all media/storage mediums and not left recoverable on backups or caches.
security_controls.integration_tips: Design deletion to mark records for sanitization and run secure deletion or cryptographic erasure where possible; track deletion tasks to completion.
security_controls.verification_method: Inspect sanitization procedures, attempt to recover deleted chat artifacts from backups, and verify logs of completed sanitization.

security_controls.section: Privacy and protection of personally identifiable information
security_controls.requirement: Implement procedures to support privacy rights, including data access, export, and deletion consistent with legislation.
security_controls.relevance: Mandates support for data subject rights including export and deletion applicable to chat histories and per-user controls.
security_controls.integration_tips: Provide transparent processes and timelines for export/delete, authenticate requestors, and document compliance with legal obligations.
security_controls.verification_method: Review data subject request procedures, test sample export-delete requests, and validate audit trail of actions.

requirements_mapping.high_level_requirement: Dataset upload, preview (tables/images/structured data), and data versioning/lineage

security_controls.requirement: File uploads must be validated, stored securely, scanned for malware, and access-controlled; previews should not expose underlying storage metadata.
security_controls.relevance: Directly applies to dataset upload and preview functionality to prevent malware, exfiltration or leakage via previews.
security_controls.integration_tips: Validate file types and sizes, run malware scanning and content inspection, strip metadata before preview, and store uploads in isolated, permissioned buckets.
security_controls.verification_method: Conduct upload fuzzing, verify malware scanning logs, and test metadata stripping on previews.

security_controls.requirement: Malicious Code Protection: The information system must employ mechanisms to detect and prevent malicious code from uploaded content.
security_controls.relevance: Covers preventing malicious content in uploaded datasets which is critical to protect processing and preview systems.
security_controls.integration_tips: Integrate AV and sandboxing for uploaded files, apply content-type validation, and restrict processing of untrusted file types.
security_controls.verification_method: Review AV/sandbox integration logs and simulate uploads of malicious artifacts to verify protection.

security_controls.requirement: Backup and versioning processes should be implemented to ensure data integrity and availability; provenance and lineage should be traceable.
security_controls.relevance: Supports data versioning/lineage and ensures datasets are backed up and provenance recorded for traceability and recovery.
security_controls.integration_tips: Implement versioned storage for datasets, capture lineage metadata on ingest, and ensure backups include provenance metadata while respecting retention policies.
security_controls.verification_method: Review versioning strategy, lineage metadata records, and backup integrity checks.

requirements_mapping.high_level_requirement: Interactive metric visualization and drag-and-drop custom dashboards with export (image/PDF)

security_controls.requirement: Ensure all data displayed in dashboards is properly encoded and rendered to prevent XSS and injection vulnerabilities.
security_controls.relevance: Dashboards that render user-supplied or dataset-derived content are susceptible to XSS; encoding is essential for secure visualization.
security_controls.integration_tips: Apply context-sensitive output encoding for HTML, SVG, and JavaScript contexts, sanitize user-supplied widgets, and restrict allowed widget scripts.
security_controls.verification_method: Run XSS tests on dashboard inputs/exports and perform code review of rendering pipelines.

security_controls.requirement: Boundary Protection: Ensure secure processing and rendering boundaries to avoid unauthorized data leakage during export processes.
security_controls.relevance: Ensures exports (PDF/image) do not leak hidden metadata or unintentional content; boundary protections prevent cross-tenant leakage.
security_controls.integration_tips: Render exports in isolated environments, strip metadata, and validate export content against user permissions before delivery.
security_controls.verification_method: Inspect exported files for metadata, test cross-tenant export attempts, and validate isolation mechanisms.

security_controls.requirement: Applications and systems providing visualization must be tested for security vulnerabilities as part of development lifecycle.
security_controls.relevance: Mandates testing of dashboard features for security vulnerabilities to prevent exploitation in visualization/export features.
security_controls.integration_tips: Include security tests in CI for dashboard components, such as SAST/DAST for rendering engines, and perform export content reviews.
security_controls.verification_method: Review security test results, CI pipelines, and results of vulnerability scans for dashboard modules.

requirements_mapping.high_level_requirement: Model registry with metadata, versioning, comparison, and model card generation

security_controls.requirement: Maintain integrity and provenance of models and associated metadata; model artifacts should be versioned and access-controlled.
security_controls.relevance: Directly relevant for model registry to ensure integrity, provenance, and access control are enforced for models and their metadata.
security_controls.integration_tips: Use signed artifacts, maintain immutable model versions, record provenance metadata (training data, hyperparameters), and protect model storage with ACLs.
security_controls.verification_method: Verify artifact signatures, examine provenance metadata, and test access control enforcement on model artifacts.

security_controls.requirement: Information System Component Inventory: The organization tracks and documents components including models and their versions.
security_controls.relevance: Requires inventory and documentation of models, which supports registry capabilities and tracking of model versions and components.
security_controls.integration_tips: Maintain an authoritative registry listing models, versions, owners, and dependencies; integrate inventory updates with CI/CD for model promotion.
security_controls.verification_method: Review model inventory, sampling to confirm metadata accuracy, and check synchronization with deployment pipelines.

security_controls.requirement: Information assets including models should be classified and protected according to sensitivity and business value.
security_controls.relevance: Model cards and registry metadata should be classified to inform protection levels for models (e.g., proprietary vs public).
security_controls.integration_tips: Classify models and apply appropriate access controls and handling rules; include classification in model cards and registry metadata.
security_controls.verification_method: Review classification labels in registry, confirm enforcement of handling rules, and audit access to classified models.

requirements_mapping.high_level_requirement: Deploy models to staging and production via UI and support A/B testing and rolling deployments

security_controls.requirement: Deployment pipelines must be secured, use signed artifacts, and support rollback; environment segregation should prevent accidental promotion of unapproved artifacts.
security_controls.relevance: Ensures secure deployment processes for models with signatures and environment segregation to prevent unauthorized promotion to production.
security_controls.integration_tips: Require artifact signing and verification during deployments, implement separate credentials for staging vs production, and provide safe rollback mechanisms.
security_controls.verification_method: Review pipeline configs for signature verification, test rollback and promotion flows, and inspect environment segregation.

security_controls.requirement: External System Services: Ensure security considerations for deployment and operational procedures including CI/CD and testing environments.
security_controls.relevance: Advises on inclusion of security in acquisition and operation of deployment tooling, relevant for A/B testing and rolling deployments.
security_controls.integration_tips: Document security requirements for deployment systems, ensure CI/CD credentials are secured and rotate secrets, and isolate A/B testing environments.
security_controls.verification_method: Review CI/CD security settings, secret storage, and evidence of security requirements in procurement or configuration.

security_controls.requirement: Changes to systems, including deployments, must follow change management procedures and be authorized prior to implementation.
security_controls.relevance: Ensures deployments (model promotions, A/B rollouts) follow approved change management to avoid accidental or unauthorized production changes.
security_controls.integration_tips: Integrate deployment UI actions with change approval workflows and retain audit trails for deployment approvals and rollouts.
security_controls.verification_method: Inspect change tickets linked to deployments and verify approvals/logs for production promotions.

requirements_mapping.high_level_requirement: Model monitoring dashboard (accuracy, drift, latency) and alerting

security_controls.requirement: Systems should monitor operational metrics and security-relevant metrics and generate alerts for anomalous behavior, including model drift indicators.
security_controls.relevance: Directly applicable for model monitoring to detect drift or anomalous performance which could indicate data or model issues.
security_controls.integration_tips: Instrument model telemetry, define thresholds for alerts, route alerts to incident management, and ensure telemetry is access-controlled and tamper-resistant.
security_controls.verification_method: Review telemetry collection, simulate drift conditions and verify alerting, and inspect alert handling records.

security_controls.requirement: Information System Monitoring: The system must detect and report security-relevant events and anomalies.
security_controls.relevance: Mandates monitoring and detection which align with model monitoring dashboards to capture anomalies and incidents.
security_controls.integration_tips: Integrate monitoring outputs with SIEM/incident systems, ensure metrics are correlated with security events, and maintain monitoring coverage for key performance indicators.
security_controls.verification_method: Check monitoring coverage, correlation rules, and incident logs for model-related alerts.

security_controls.requirement: Responsibilities and procedures for incident detection and reporting should be established, including monitoring systems for service performance and security incidents.
security_controls.relevance: Ensures there are procedures for responding to monitoring alerts (e.g., model drift) as part of incident management.
security_controls.integration_tips: Define owner responsibilities for monitoring alerts, document response playbooks for model issues, and train on escalation paths.
security_controls.verification_method: Review incident response plans and perform tabletop exercises for model-monitoring incidents.

requirements_mapping.high_level_requirement: Commenting, threaded discussions, @mentions and real-time collaboration on projects

security_controls.requirement: User-generated content must be sanitized and encoded to prevent XSS; real-time components must protect against injection and CSRF.
security_controls.relevance: Applies to comments/threaded content and @mentions to prevent injection attacks and cross-site scripting in collaboration features.
security_controls.integration_tips: Sanitize and encode messages for display contexts, enforce CSRF protections on actions, and limit allowed markup or provide a safe subset for rich text.
security_controls.verification_method: Perform XSS and injection testing on commenting and mention features and review sanitization libraries used.

security_controls.requirement: Cryptographic Protection: Communications and collaboration channels should be protected to ensure confidentiality and integrity.
security_controls.relevance: Real-time collaboration requires protection of message channels to prevent eavesdropping or tampering, ensuring integrity of threaded discussions.
security_controls.integration_tips: Use TLS for transport, apply end-to-end protections where feasible, and authenticate message sources to prevent impersonation via mentions.
security_controls.verification_method: Inspect TLS configurations, review message authentication mechanisms, and verify integrity protections.

security_controls.requirement: Policies for use of collaboration tools and acceptable use should be defined and enforced.
security_controls.relevance: Ensures policies governing use of collaboration tools are in place and applied to protect project discussions and collaboration.
security_controls.integration_tips: Define acceptable use policies for collaboration, include guidance on sharing sensitive information in comments, and enforce via training and technical controls.
security_controls.verification_method: Review policies and conduct audits of collaboration use for policy compliance.

requirements_mapping.high_level_requirement: Public project showcase with opt-in sharing controls

security_controls.requirement: Publishing or sharing features must be explicit (opt-in) and enforce authorization checks; privacy controls should prevent accidental exposure.
security_controls.relevance: Directly enforces opt-in sharing and authorization checks required for public showcases to prevent accidental publicity.
security_controls.integration_tips: Require explicit consent/opt-in UI for public projects, maintain an audit of opt-ins, and provide an easy revoke/unpublish flow that propagates to caches/search indexes.
security_controls.verification_method: Test publish/unpublish flows, check audit logs for opt-in actions, and verify propagation to public endpoints.

security_controls.requirement: Rules of Behavior: Organizations must define user responsibilities for sharing information and explicit user consent when making data public.
security_controls.relevance: Requires defining responsibilities and consent which applies to users publishing public projects.
security_controls.integration_tips: Document rules of behavior for public sharing, require explicit consent flows, and provide training for users about public exposure risks.
security_controls.verification_method: Review rules of behavior, confirm consent flows, and audit public project listings for adherence.

security_controls.section: Privacy and protection of personally identifiable information
security_controls.requirement: When making information public, procedures must ensure compliance with applicable privacy regulations and consent requirements.
security_controls.relevance: Ensures that public sharing respects privacy laws and consent obligations, critical for public showcases to avoid PII exposure.
security_controls.integration_tips: Include PII detection in publish flow, require data owner sign-off for content containing possible PII, and record consent evidence.
security_controls.verification_method: Review publish-time checks for PII, consent capture records, and legal/compliance reviews of public content.

requirements_mapping.high_level_requirement: Integration adapters for cloud storage (S3/GCS/Azure), external ML platforms and CI/CD

security_controls.requirement: Integrations to cloud storage and external services must use strong authentication, least privilege, and secure credential handling (e.g., short-lived tokens).
security_controls.relevance: Directly pertains to adapters connecting to S3/GCS/Azure and other platforms: requires secure auth and credential management.
security_controls.integration_tips: Use short-lived credentials (STS), role-based access, and avoid long-lived secrets; rotate credentials and store them in a secrets manager.
security_controls.verification_method: Inspect credential handling, verify use of short-lived tokens, and review permissions granted to adapter service accounts.

security_controls.requirement: Remote Access: Control and secure remote connections to external services and cloud resources; enforce strong authentication and encryption.
security_controls.relevance: Applies to remote connections to cloud services used by adapters and demands secure channels and authentication.
security_controls.integration_tips: Enforce TLS for all remote connections, mandate mutual TLS where appropriate, and log remote access for audit.
security_controls.verification_method: Review network/TLS configurations and logs of remote connections to cloud services.

security_controls.requirement: Where functions are outsourced or integrated externally, security requirements must be defined and enforced, including credential and access controls.
security_controls.relevance: If adapters integrate with external services or third-party platforms, security requirements for those relationships must be established.
security_controls.integration_tips: Define SLAs/security requirements for integrations and ensure secure onboarding of third-party connectors with scoped access and audits.
security_controls.verification_method: Review third-party agreements, connector security assessments, and integration onboarding documentation.

requirements_mapping.high_level_requirement: Secure APIs for artifact storage, model deployment, and telemetry ingestion

security_controls.requirement: APIs must authenticate and authorize requests, validate input, enforce rate-limiting, use TLS, and protect against common API attacks.
security_controls.relevance: Directly covers security expectations for APIs handling artifacts, deployments, and telemetry ingestion to prevent abuse and data compromise.
security_controls.integration_tips: Enforce token-based auth (OAuth2/JWT) with scopes, validate all inputs and payloads, apply rate limits, and require TLS with strong ciphers.
security_controls.verification_method: API security testing (fuzzing, auth bypass tests), review TLS configs, and examine rate-limit enforcement logs.

security_controls.requirement: Cryptographic Protection: Protect API communications and sensitive data in transit with approved cryptography.
security_controls.relevance: Mandates cryptographic protection of API communications, essential for telemetry and artifact transfers containing sensitive info.
security_controls.integration_tips: Use TLS for transport, encrypt payloads where necessary, and manage keys with a KMS. Avoid weak cipher suites and protocol versions.
security_controls.verification_method: Review TLS termination points, cipher suite lists, and key management practices.

security_controls.requirement: Use of privileged interfaces and APIs must be restricted and controlled with appropriate authentication and authorization.
security_controls.relevance: APIs for deployment/ingestion may provide privileged operations; this control ensures their usage is restricted and audited.
security_controls.integration_tips: Segment privileged API endpoints, require higher assurance (MFA, IP allowlists) for privileged ops, and log/monitor privileged API calls.
security_controls.verification_method: Review access controls for privileged endpoints, inspect logs of privileged calls, and test enforcement of additional protections.

requirements_mapping.high_level_requirement: Data retention, export, deletion and data subject rights workflows for compliance

security_controls.requirement: Data retention and deletion policies must be enforced programmatically; provide mechanisms to export and delete personal data in accordance with legal requirements.
security_controls.relevance: Directly applicable to retention/export/deletion and data subject workflows supporting regulatory compliance (e.g., GDPR).
security_controls.integration_tips: Implement automated retention enforcement, authenticated export endpoints, and deletion flows that remove data from live and archived stores as required.
security_controls.verification_method: Test retention enforcement, perform data export requests, and validate deletion propagation and logs.

security_controls.requirement: Media Sanitization: Ensure secure disposal and sanitization of media and data when no longer required.
security_controls.relevance: Covers secure sanitization for deleted data and ensures exports/deletions actually remove data from all media including backups.
security_controls.integration_tips: Document sanitization procedures for primary and backup storage, use cryptographic erasure where possible, and validate deletion completion.
security_controls.verification_method: Perform recovery attempts on sanitized media, and review sanitization logs and procedures.

security_controls.section: Privacy and protection of personally identifiable information
security_controls.requirement: Organizations must adhere to legal and regulatory requirements relating to data retention and subject rights.
security_controls.relevance: Mandates alignment with legal obligations for retention and data subject rights, applying to export and deletion workflows.
security_controls.integration_tips: Maintain a legally-aligned retention schedule, provide clear DSAR (data subject access request) processes, and log all DSAR activities.
security_controls.verification_method: Review retention schedules, test DSAR handling, and audit logs for DSAR fulfillment.

requirements_mapping.high_level_requirement: Audit, logging, encryption, and monitoring for security and operational observability

security_controls.requirement: Implement sufficient logging, secure log storage, and monitoring to detect security incidents; ensure logs are integrity-protected and access-controlled.
security_controls.relevance: Directly addresses core requirements for logging, encryption of logs, and monitoring to support security and operations observability.
security_controls.integration_tips: Protect logs with write-once or HMAC integrity, centralize logs in SIEM, restrict log access, and encrypt logs at rest and in transit.
security_controls.verification_method: Inspect log integrity protections, review SIEM alerts, and test log access controls.

security_controls.requirement: Use of cryptographic authentication mechanisms and key management controls to protect secrets and authentication tokens.
security_controls.relevance: Key management and cryptography underpin secure storage of secrets, encryption of telemetry, and protection of logs and artifacts.
security_controls.integration_tips: Use a centralized KMS for key lifecycle, protect authentication tokens using hardware-backed storage where possible, and rotate keys regularly.
security_controls.verification_method: Review key management practices, KMS configuration, and evidence of key rotation and access controls.

security_controls.section: Policy on the use of cryptographic controls
security_controls.requirement: Use cryptographic controls to protect confidentiality, integrity of information and manage keys appropriately.
security_controls.relevance: Provides policy-level mandate to use cryptography for encrypting sensitive logs, telemetry, artifacts and for overall observability data protection.
security_controls.integration_tips: Create cryptography policy, select approved algorithms, and integrate cryptographic controls into logging and telemetry pipelines with KMS support.
security_controls.verification_method: Review cryptography policy and check that deployed systems use approved algorithms and key management according to policy.

requirements_mapping.high_level_requirement: Administrative features: tenant settings, billing integration, usage reporting, and quota management

security_controls.requirement: Administrative interfaces must be protected with high assurance authentication, authorization, and auditability; separate admin functions from normal user functions.
security_controls.relevance: Administrative tenant/billing interfaces require high protection to avoid misuse or fraudulent changes; separation from user functions is crucial.
security_controls.integration_tips: Enforce MFA for admin accounts, restrict admin UI by IP or role, segregate admin APIs, and maintain detailed audit logs for all admin actions.
security_controls.verification_method: Test admin authentication flows (MFA), review segregation of admin endpoints, and inspect admin action logs.

security_controls.requirement: Separation of Duties: The system must support separation of duties and prevent conflict of interest by restricting access to administrative functions.
security_controls.relevance: Prevents a single administrative user from performing incompatible tasks on billing/tenant settings, mitigating risk of fraud or abuse.
security_controls.integration_tips: Implement RBAC that separates billing, tenant admin, and audit roles; require dual-control for sensitive billing changes.
security_controls.verification_method: Review role separation, test that a single role cannot perform conflicting admin actions, and inspect change logs.

security_controls.requirement: Systems performing administrative or billing tasks should be subject to technical reviews to ensure compliance with security requirements.
security_controls.relevance: Mandates technical reviews/audits of admin/billing modules to ensure they meet security and compliance expectations.
security_controls.integration_tips: Schedule regular security reviews for admin components, include billing integrations in compliance scans, and remediate findings promptly.
security_controls.verification_method: Review technical audit reports and confirm remediation of identified issues.

cross_functional_controls.description: Comprehensive logging of security-relevant events, user actions, admin actions, and system changes with tamper-evidence and retention policies.
applies_to: All requirements that involve user actions, admin operations, data changes, sharing, deployments, AI outputs, and integrations
cross_functional_controls.implementation_guidance: Centralize logs into a SIEM with access controls, ensure logs are integrity-protected (WORM/HMAC), include contextual metadata (user, project, request-id), and define retention/archival policies aligned with compliance.

cross_functional_controls.description: Use approved cryptography to protect data at rest and in transit and manage keys via a centralized KMS with lifecycle controls.
applies_to: Authentication tokens, chat histories, artifacts, model binaries, backups, telemetry, and API communications
cross_functional_controls.implementation_guidance: Encrypt data at rest with AES-256 or approved alternatives, enforce TLS for transport, use KMS for key rotation and access controls, and implement cryptographic policies and audits.

cross_functional_controls.description: Centralized authorization system enforcing least privilege, separation of duties, and object-level policies (roles, tags, metadata).
applies_to: User management, projects, datasets, model registry, sharing features, and admin interfaces
cross_functional_controls.implementation_guidance: Implement server-side enforcement, use ABAC for tag/metadata-based rules, integrate with identity providers for SSO, and perform periodic access reviews and audits.

cross_functional_controls.description: Sanitize all inbound content (uploads, comments, templates) and apply context-sensitive encoding for outputs to prevent XSS and injection.
applies_to: File uploads, dashboards, comments, chat, visualizations, exports
cross_functional_controls.implementation_guidance: Validate and sanitize inputs, use safe rendering libraries for HTML/SVG, restrict allowed markup in user content, and strip metadata from exported artifacts.

cross_functional_controls.control_name: Data Subject Rights and Retention Management
cross_functional_controls.description: Programmatic enforcement of retention policies, and processes supporting export and deletion requests (DSARs) with verification and propagation to backups.
applies_to: Chat history, datasets, user profiles, telemetry, and backups
cross_functional_controls.implementation_guidance: Provide authenticated DSAR interfaces, maintain audit trails for requests, implement deletion workflows that handle backups, and ensure compliance with legal retention requirements.

requirements_mapping.high_level_requirement: User registration and login with email/password and social OAuth (Google, GitHub)

security_controls.requirement: Verify all authentication functions require a username and password, and sessions are established using secure session tokens. Passwords are validated using secure hashing and salting algorithms.
security_controls.relevance: Directly applies to email/password registration and login; ensures session tokens and password storage use secure methods. It sets baseline authentication security requirements for any user login functionality.
security_controls.integration_tips: Use strong hashing (e.g., bcrypt/argon2) with per-user salts and enforce secure session tokens with proper attributes (HttpOnly, Secure, SameSite). Ensure registration flows validate inputs and do not leak account existence via timing/errors.
security_controls.verification_method: Review password hashing configurations, perform code inspection of authentication code, and run authentication flow tests including session token attribute checks.

security_controls.requirement: Authenticator Management: Organizations manage information system authenticators by establishing, issuing, and revoking authenticators such as passwords and tokens.
security_controls.relevance: Covers lifecycle of authenticators for email/password and OAuth tokens; ensures proper issuance and revocation processes exist. Important for handling account compromises and token revocation for social logins.
security_controls.integration_tips: Implement centralized authenticator lifecycle management including password reset, rotation, and revocation for OAuth tokens. Integrate with identity provider APIs to revoke tokens and maintain revocation logs.
security_controls.verification_method: Inspect authenticator management procedures, test token revocation flows with providers, and review logs showing issuance and revocation events.

security_controls.requirement: User access provisioning should be implemented based on business and information security requirements. Access rights shall be reviewed regularly.
security_controls.relevance: Ensures that user accounts created via registration are provisioned with appropriate rights and subject to periodic review. Applies to initial account creation and social/OAuth-linked accounts.
security_controls.integration_tips: Implement user provisioning workflows that assign minimal default privileges and include periodic access reviews. Link account lifecycle events to provisioning records for auditability.
security_controls.verification_method: Review provisioning workflows, sample user accounts to verify assigned rights, and review records of access right reviews.

requirements_mapping.high_level_requirement: Single Sign-On (SSO) via OIDC and SAML for enterprise customers

security_controls.requirement: Applications that support federated authentication must validate identity tokens using the provider's public keys and verify all token claims and audiences.
security_controls.relevance: Direct requirement for OIDC/SAML validation; enforces cryptographic validation of tokens and checking of claims to prevent impersonation. Essential for secure SSO.
security_controls.integration_tips: Use well-maintained libraries to validate ID tokens and SAML assertions, fetch and cache provider public keys (JWKS), and verify audience, issuer, expiry, and nonce parameters.
security_controls.verification_method: Penetration testing of SSO flows, code review of token/assertion validation, and checks that invalid/malformed tokens are rejected.

security_controls.requirement: Use of SAML and other federated identity attributes for authentication must ensure assertions are validated and replay-protected.
security_controls.relevance: Specifies validation and replay protection for SAML/OIDC assertions which is directly applicable to SSO. Prevents assertion replay and misuse of federated credentials.
security_controls.integration_tips: Implement audience restriction, timestamp checks, one-time-use/nonces, and verify assertion freshness. Employ secure channels for metadata exchange and rotate keys as necessary.
security_controls.verification_method: Review SAML/OIDC library configurations, test replay attempts, and verify assertion validation logic and timestamps.

security_controls.requirement: Where required, secure log-on procedures shall be implemented, and authentication mechanisms should support federated identity when used by the organization.
security_controls.relevance: Provides organizational control requiring secure log-on and allowance for federated identity; aligns policy with SSO implementation. Ensures SSO is integrated into secure access policies.
security_controls.integration_tips: Update access control policies to include federation; document how SSO providers are approved and how authentication is logged. Ensure training and procedures for SSO onboarding.
security_controls.verification_method: Review policy documents, SSO onboarding records, and evidence that secure log-on procedures are followed (logs, configurations).

security_controls.relevance: Directly applicable to implementing RBAC and enforcing server-side checks for roles like Admin and Data Scientist in team contexts. Prevents client-side bypass.
security_controls.integration_tips: Design RBAC with clearly defined roles and permissions, implement centralized server-side policy enforcement, and model team workspace scoping for resource access.
security_controls.verification_method: Access control tests (attempt privilege escalation), code review for server-side enforcement, and role permission matrices verification.

security_controls.requirement: Account Management: The organization manages system accounts, including owner, group, and role assignments and privileges.
security_controls.relevance: Describes account and role management processes required to implement RBAC and team workspaces, ensuring accounts and roles are managed consistently.
security_controls.integration_tips: Define role lifecycle procedures (creation, modification, removal), standardize role definitions, and integrate with identity management for teams and groups.
security_controls.verification_method: Review account management procedures, audit role assignment logs, and sample checks of group/role membership.
